results.title: The Coastguard
results.creator_credit: Michael Barden, R.H.R. Productions and Simon Campbell-Jones
results.brief_description: The film was made for the 150th anniversary of the founding of H.M. Coastguard. It shows the work carried out by the Coastguard Service in saving life at sea and on the coast, both directly and through their co-ordination with R.A.F. Navy, Post Office and R.N.L.I.

results.title: The Coasters
results.creator_credit: Stanhope Andrews, New Zealand National Film Unit and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: Small coastal shipping in New Zealand, showing life on a coaster, loading, ports, storm at sea, dramatic incidents. The commentary is in rythmical verse.

results.title: The Coast: a question of balance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development, Dept of the Navy and David Hughes
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Mornington Peninsula, Bellarine Peninsula, Apollo Bay, Torquay, Westernport Bay and Port Melbourne, this film is designed to alert students to the conflict inherent in man’s use of the coastal system, potentially one of the most fragile of environments. Shows the abuse of the sand dune systems through leisure, sport, traffic and the erection of structures, as well as the heavy demands placed by industry and shipping on coastal waters. Stresses that these competing interests will, if left unchecked, ultimately destroy the delicate flora and fauna balance of the coastal system. Music performed by Pink Floyd - “Be careful with that axe, Eugene” Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Coal question
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, CSIRO and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: There are many questions raised about how coal, Australia’s major export earner, can be used most effectively and most responsibly. This film looks at the role of science in confronting these questions and describes the efforts and results of researchers in areas such as mine safety, coal to oil conversion and pollution control systems.

results.title: The Clubhouse boat
results.brief_description: This film tells of the plight of some young boys whose desire to purchase a boat leads them to commit misdemeanours in order to collect sufficient funds. The story explores the conflicts of loyalty and honesty that arise in the various situations experienced by individuals in the group in their attempts to find cash in a hurry. The story deliberately has no ending so that audiences can make up their own choices and decisions for an appropriate ending.

results.title: The Club
results.creator_credit: Richard K. Cheung, Bang Bang Films and Kirk Wong
results.brief_description: A Triad gang in charge of a popular club fights to keep it from falling into a rival gang’s hands. Along with films by directors such as Tsui Hark and Ringo Lam, “The Club” was one of the first films of the “Hong Kong new wave”. It stood apart from other action films of the time due to its gritty realism and raw violence. Most of the major actors (including the lead Chan Wai Man) were current or former Triad members, and Wong took great pains to film in actual locations, even going so far as to securing “protection” from local gangs. Wong’s filming style, which took on an almost documentary-like quality, also stood apart from the colorful, fanciful films being produced in Hong Kong in the early eighties. He went on to make ‘Crime Story’ (1993) starring Jackie Chan and ‘The Big Hit’ in Hollywood in 1998. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Clown princes of Hollywood. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam, Sterling Educational Films and Gregstan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Explains that some of the early comedians like Charlie Chaplin and Harold Lloyd became Hollywood royalty, while others who made audiences laugh but never reached the top of the ladder were dubbed “clown princes”. Uses original silent footage to examine the different styles and personalities of some of the comedians, including Charlie Chaplin, Harold Lloyd, Larry Seman, Charlie Chase, Laurel and Hardy, Ben Turpin and Billy West.

results.title: The Clown of God (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel, Ernest Troost and Gary McGivney
results.brief_description: A beautifully filmed adaptation of the Tomi de Paola story about Giovanni, the clown who juggled for a living during the Middle Ages. Now, old and penniless, he returns to his birthplace seeking refuge in the church on Christmas Eve. Watching the procession of gifts for the Holy Child, he offers the only gift he has - one last performance. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: The Clown
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cohn, Richard Balducci and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A shaggy dog, Clown, lives in Paris with a street urchin: the two are inseparable. One day Clown runs off while the boy plays with friends. Using a painting of Clown, the boy desperately tries to find his dog. He has nearly given up when he at last sees clown and rushes to embrace it. Joy turns to despair as the boy realises the dog has attached itself to a blind man. The boy walks away.
